text: [Music]
once upon a time a fisherman as usual
cast his net in the river he waited
patiently in his boat eating his lunch
when he heard a curious sound
[Music]
while waiting by the river he saw a
cradle made of crystal come bobbing down
the river right up to his boats the
fisherman reached over and grabbed the
little package inside which were
coverings of the finest silk he had ever
seen he removed them and saw the faces
of two beautiful babies
the fisherman's heart was filled with
tenderness and he took the babies home
wait see who I have found in the river
today two babies we already have four
children to feed so what would you have
rather had me do let them drown in the
river or starve I know well if we have
enough food for the six of us we shall
have enough for the eight of us food was
always a plenty in the fisherman's
household and soon the two babies grew
up to be a beautiful boy and girl as
gentle as they were wise and as
well-mannered as they were righteous but
the other children were not kind to them
and often said thanks to them that were
mean give me back my doll father brought
it for me I thought he said we could all
share it but he is not your father is he
found you in a river go play with your
crystal cradle that is the only thing
that belongs to you the brother and
sister would sometimes become so weary
but they would take off to the wood to
be by themselves there they would take
the bread they had saved up from their
breakfast and crumble it for the birds
who taught them many things in return
such as the language of the birds ways
to live in a forest
and one night after the other children
had been particularly mean to them the
orphan brother and sister decided no
matter how hard we try they just do not
like us and that puts mother and father
in a fix
don't you think it is best that we
laughed mother and father are going to
town tomorrow we shall leave after they
have gone so that day when the fisherman
and his wife left for the town the
brother and sister left the homes into
the forest they walked for three days
and by the time it was night they got
very tired suddenly they saw a Hut in
the distance look there do you think we
should go and see we might get some
shelter there they went to the hut and
knocked but no one was around now what
do we do well see there is a bench here
at least we could rest here for the
night so they settled down on the bench
to rest but none of them could sleep as
they lay awake looking at the moon and
the stars they suddenly heard some
sounds there was a huge chatter in the
trees nearby and since they knew the
language of birds they could understand
what the birds were doing you came here
from this city
my my how did you ever think of your
poor friends in the forest Wow just a
change of air I have been having cold
lately
birds also develop cold Shh listen so
what is the latest in the big happening
city oh just the usual the poor King is
still miserable nothing ever seems to
give him solace and peace it must have
been hard for him with the Queen and the
children gone
oh no she has not gone she has been
locked up in the tower what do you mean
wow I haven't seen it myself but I know
when old cuckoo lives in the palace
garden go ahead tell us what you heard
him you do know that the King married a
beautiful woman he had fallen in love
with of course we do yes see the maiden
was as wise as she was beautiful and the
King loved her dearly she found out that
some palace officials and ministers were
Lewton the King and she sought to expose
them really yes but those corrupt
officials got wind of this and when the
King had to go to war they arrested the
Queen and locked up in a tower and the
prince and the princess they took the
twins put them in a crystal cradle and
sent them floatin over the river
the cuckoo says he saw it himself the
moment the brother and sister heard of
the crystal cradle they thought of the
cradle they had been put in floating on
the river when the fisherman had seen
them and brought them home
they'll play with your crystal cradle
that is the only thing that belongs to
you didn't the King try to find them
apparently the corrupt officials told

with the two children the King does not
even know of his wife being locked up in

princess went to the palace would the
King recognize them you speak our
language
yes we do some birds like you were kind
enough to teach us ah the crystal cradle
you were speaking of well we were laid
in the cradle and sent a float the river
where a fisherman found us and took us
home
that means you were the prince and the
princess well look at their charming

believe them
how will they prove who they are to the
king there is a bird the bird of truth
the only bird in the whole wide world
who can speak the language of men the
bird is aware of every truth in the
world only he can help you where can we
find him there is a witch who lives in a

tell you the way to the castle of come
and never go where the bird is held
captive but before you enter the castle
speak to the owl who can only speak one
word of men cross
thank you so much we shall do whatever
it takes to get back to our Father so
the prince and the princess walked into
the forest they were so happy and so
eager to meet their father and finally
free their mother that they forgot all
about their hunger and tiredness and
walked on
they finally came to the cave in the

they bravely knocked on the door who
dare come here at this unearthly power
my my what are you doing here we need to
know the way to the castle of come and

but we really do want to be on our way I

in the corner a silver dove do all of

liar
I am the real bird of truth no the

so you found the real bird of truth is
it where is the water from the
many-colored
fountain turn into lizards both of you
but instead of becoming lizards the

to be seen again the children went to
the palace but the wicked ministers
would not let them in we can never show
them the bird of truth or else they will
never let us in we will just tell them
if we want to see the king what are you
two children doing here we want to meet
the king we have a small gift for him
how dare you disturb our King off with
you come on but the bird of truth flew
out of the bag straight into the King's
chambers through the window and told the
king everything
so you're good Queen is locked in that
tower and your prince and princess wait
for you outside the palace the King
rushed out and hugged his two children
the wicked ministers were arrested and
the good Queen was freed from the tower
the King rewarded the fisherman and his
wife handsomely for their kindness and
from then on the prince and princess
lived happily ever after with their
parents
